Medicine.q: Most common cause of community-acquired pneumonia in adults?
Medicine.explanation: Streptococcus pneumoniae remains the leading cause of CAP in immunocompetent adults.

Medicine.q: Best initial management step in diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA)?
Medicine.explanation: Volume resuscitation with isotonic saline is the first step; insulin and potassium follow based on labs.

Medicine.q: Earliest ECG change in hyperkalemia?
Medicine.explanation: Tall, peaked T waves are typically the earliest finding.

Medicine.q: Which drug class reduces mortality in HFrEF?
Medicine.explanation: ACE inhibitors/ARNI, beta-blockers, and MRAs improve survival; diuretics and digoxin relieve symptoms.

Medicine.q: Best reperfusion strategy for STEMI presenting within 90 minutes to PCI-capable center?
Medicine.explanation: Primary PCI within recommended door-to-balloon time offers best outcomes when rapidly available.

Medicine.q: Most specific test for rheumatoid arthritis?
Medicine.explanation: Anti-cyclic citrullinated peptide (anti-CCP) antibodies have high specificity for RA.

Medicine.q: Nephrotic syndrome is defined by proteinuria exceeding:
Medicine.explanation: Nephrotic-range proteinuria is >3.5 g/day with hypoalbuminemia and edema.

Medicine.q: First-line bronchodilator in acute severe asthma exacerbation?
Medicine.explanation: Short-acting beta-2 agonists are first-line; anticholinergics and steroids are adjuncts.

Medicine.q: In suspected infective endocarditis, the next best step before starting antibiotics?
Medicine.explanation: Blood cultures prior to antibiotics maximize yield for pathogen identification.

Medicine.q: Most appropriate initial test for hypothyroidism?
Medicine.explanation: TSH is the best screening test; free T4 helps classify severity.

Medicine.q: Which finding suggests SIADH in hyponatremia?
Medicine.explanation: SIADH: euvolemic hyponatremia with inappropriately concentrated urine and high urine sodium.

Medicine.q: Emergency temporizing therapy for life-threatening hyperkalemia with ECG changes?
Medicine.explanation: IV calcium stabilizes cardiac membranes; insulin/glucose and beta-agonists shift K+ intracellularly.

Medicine.q: Which test is preferred to confirm H. pylori eradication after therapy?
Medicine.explanation: Urea breath test or stool antigen test are preferred for confirming eradication; serology is not reliable post-treatment.

Medicine.q: A patient with chronic liver disease has ascites with SAAG 1.5 g/dL. Interpretation?
Medicine.explanation: SAAG â‰¥1.1 g/dL indicates portal hypertension as the cause of ascites.

Medicine.q: Which enzyme is more specific for acute pancreatitis?
Medicine.explanation: Serum lipase rises earlier and is more specific for pancreatitis than amylase.

Medicine.q: Investigation of choice for evaluating a solitary thyroid nodule?
Medicine.explanation: Ultrasound-guided FNAC provides cytology for diagnosis; scan is reserved when TSH is suppressed.

Medicine.q: Best initial test to screen for diabetes mellitus in an asymptomatic adult?
Medicine.explanation: Fasting plasma glucose or HbA1c are standard screening tests; OGTT is diagnostic in equivocal cases.

Medicine.q: Treatment that prevents isoniazid-induced peripheral neuropathy?
Medicine.explanation: Pyridoxine supplementation prevents INH-induced neuropathy.

Medicine.q: Which anticoagulant is preferred in pregnancy for VTE?
Medicine.explanation: LMWH is preferred due to safety and predictable dosing; warfarin is teratogenic.

Medicine.q: Most appropriate next step in suspected PE in a hemodynamically stable patient with high clinical probability?
Medicine.explanation: CTPA is the investigation of choice in stable patients with adequate renal function.
